intro: Sisymbrium orientale, commonly known as the oriental peppergrass, is an annual herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branching stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom from May to July. The plant has pinnately divided leaves and produces long, slender pods containing several seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Sisymbrium orientale is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its historical use in traditional medicine.
